alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 03 at 1:39PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of eastern and southeast Idaho, including the following areas, in eastern Idaho, Big Hole Mountains, Centennial Mountains - Island Park and Teton Valley. In southeast Idaho, Bear Lake Valley, Bear River Range, Blackfoot Mountains, Caribou Range, Franklin/Eastern Oneida Region, Marsh and Arbon Highlands and Upper Snake River Plain. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Localized flash flooding is possible from heavy rainfall rates, continuous, or training storms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain
